physical_appearance:The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features three ladies. All of them are standing up and looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured. They are wearing their ethnic costumes as well. They are standing on carpeted ground.

sgcool_label_text:This studio photograph shows three nyonyas standing between a covered table and a potted plant.\r\n\r\nStudios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s
 Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This studio photograph shows three nyonyas standing between a covered table and a potted plant.

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
